required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Phenotypes of COPD Patients Between in Plateau and Plain
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiological Phenotypes of Patients With Stable COPD Between in Plateau and Plain

brief_summary.textblock: We aimed to collect clinical and radiological data of patients with stable COPD in plateau and plain, and compare the clinical phenotypic characteristics and imaging features of COPD patients in these two areas.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the clinical phenotypic characteristics and imaging features of patients with stable chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) in plateau and plain. We conducted a cross-sectional study, collecting clinical data of stable patients in plateau and plain, and comparing the clinical phenotypic characteristics and imaging features of COPD patients in these two areas.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data were obtained during the interview.
Data were obtained during the interview.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of exacerbations in the past year

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data were obtained during the interview.

primary_outcome.description: The percentage of the LAA divided by total lung volumes (LAA%) was used as an index of the severity of emphysema in quantitative CT examination.
Bronchial wall thickness (WT, mm) was used as one of the measurements for assessment of airway remodeling in quantitative CT examination.
Luminal area (LA, mm2) was used as one of the measurements for assessment of airway remodeling in quantitative CT examination.
Bronchial wall area (WA, mm2) was used as one of the measurements for assessment of airway remodeling in quantitative CT examination.

arm_group.description: We consecutively enrolled COPD patients visiting the outpatient of Respiratory Medicine at Tibet Autonomous Region People's Hospital from January 2018 to December 2021.
We consecutively enrolled COPD patients visiting the outpatient of Respiratory Medicine at Peking University Third Hospital from January 2018 to December 2021.

study_pop.textblock: We consecutively enrolled patients with COPD from January 2018 to December 2021, who visited the outpatient of Department of Respiratory Medicine in Peking University Third Hospital or Tibet Autonomous Region People's Hospital.
